name: Topics in Teaching and Learning
title: SESP MS_ED 451-0-20 Topics in Teaching and Learning

descriptions.name: Overview of Class
descriptions.value: Contact the department for further information

class_attributes:
Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Department Majors Only
subject: MS_ED

overview_of_class: The course is intended to deepen conceptual understanding of middle school and high school geometry topics, especially as related to attributes and relationships of geometric objects. Topics will include analyzing two- and three-dimensional space and figures using distance, angle, similarity, and congruence; informal geometric constructions; right triangles and trigonometry; circles; understanding and applying the Pythagorean Theorem; and coordinate geometry with algebraic representations. Emphases will be placed on geometric reasoning, proof, and modeling. The course will utilize dynamic geometry software as a tool to investigate and model geometric phenomena.
